intro: Tetracera nordtiana var. wuthiana, commonly known as the Wuthia tetracera, is a rare and flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are unisexual and arranged in cyathia. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare species with conservation concerns.
